alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Franklin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 12:42AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Catahoula and Franklin Parishes through 130 AM CDT... At 1242 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Liddieville to near Rosefield. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Liddieville around 1250 AM CDT. Winnsboro and Enterprise around 100 AM CDT. Jigger around 115 AM CDT. Wisner around 120 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Gilbert and Baskin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees.
